excellent: Flat, controlled bass. Every note lands clean and even.
Low-end is totally behaved. No boom, no wobble.
Tight punch without any bloat or mess.
good: Mostly smooth. Only tiny bumps left behind.
Nice, tidy bass. Nothing distracting.
A couple of small ripples, nothing to lose sleep over.
okay: Some notes jump out, others dip back. Room is having its say.
Bass line wobbles a bit. You’ll hear the occasional bump or drop.
A bit lumpy in places. Could do with a tweak or two.
needs_work: Boomy or thin depending on the note. Very uneven.
Room is throwing big peaks and deep dips at you.
Bass is all over the place. Placement needs proper attention.

excellent: Nudge each speaker forward 1–2 cm to iron out the last tiny ripple.
Try moving your seat 10–20 cm to find the absolute sweet spot.
Mark the current positions — this low-end control is gold.
good: Pull each speaker forward 5–10 cm to clean up a mild hump.
Widen the speakers 3–5 cm if vocals sound a touch hollow.
Adjust toe-in by 2–3° to soften any sharp treble peaks.
okay: Bring speakers forward 10–20 cm to calm down boominess.
Move your seat 20–30 cm if bass feels weak — you’re sitting in a dip.
Widen speakers 5–10 cm to tidy up boxy or honky mids.
needs_work: Pull speakers 25–40 cm from the wall to stop the worst peaks.
Shift the seat 30–60 cm — you’re likely stuck in a big null.
Try a tiny left/right mismatch — rooms love breaking symmetry.

excellent: Crystal clear. No echo getting in the way.
No early reflections messing with the sound.
Fast, clean attack. Nothing smearing the highs.
good: Very little echo. Only a soft side-wall bounce remains.
Clear soundstage. A small tweak will perfect it.
Minor echo left. Easy to fix with simple soft furnishings.
okay: Some blur in the mids and highs. The room is bouncing stuff back.
Stereo image feels a bit washed out by reflections.
You can hear slap-back off the walls or floor.
needs_work: Reflections everywhere. Clarity is taking a hit.
Room sounds bright and fatiguing. Too much hard surface.
The room is ringing. Needs softening straight away.

excellent: Add something soft at the side-wall ‘mirror points’ for extra polish.
Toe-in by 1–2° to control how much treble hits the walls.
Check tweeter height — 2–3 cm can tighten things further.
good: Put a cushion/curtain/throw at the mirror points to calm early reflections.
Increase toe-in a touch to send more sound to you, less to the walls.
Close or thicken curtains to reduce that last bit of slap echo.
okay: Add a rug between you and the speakers — floor reflections are brutal.
Soft items on the side walls help without needing ‘real’ panels.
Raise/lower speakers 2–4 cm if the high mids feel smeared.
needs_work: Treat the first-reflection points with anything soft you have.
Move speakers away from bare windows/corners where sound bounces hard.
Add something soft to break up brightness — cushions, rugs, throws.

excellent: Full-range sound. Nothing missing top or bottom.
Deep bass and nice airy highs — great extension.
The rolloff behaves exactly as it should.
good: Good range with only a slight dip at one end.
Solid extension, just a bit room-limited somewhere.
Nice range. Small tweaks will unlock the last bit of sparkle.
okay: Missing a bit of bass or top-end extension.
Something in the room is stealing low or high energy.
Placement is holding the speaker back from full range.
needs_work: Very narrow range — bass and air are both muted.
Highs or lows missing — speaker isn’t breathing properly.
Room/speaker setup is choking the full frequency spread.

excellent: Move speakers forward 2–3 cm for a tiny bass lift.
Adjust toe-in 1–2° to fine-tune treble reach.
Make sure your ears line up with the tweeter height.
good: Move speakers forward 5–10 cm for extra low-end reach.
Match ear height to the tweeter for more top-end clarity.
Widen speakers 5–8 cm to open the mids and lows.
okay: Pull speakers 10–20 cm from the wall for more extension.
Adjust seat height slightly to rebalance clarity.
Add toe-in if treble feels dull.
needs_work: Pull speakers 20–40 cm from the wall to bring bass back.
Reduce toe-in if highs feel weak — might be over-aimed.
Move your seat forward 20–40 cm to escape a deep null.

excellent: Perfect tonal balance across the whole spectrum.
Everything blends cleanly — nothing sticks out.
Channel balance is spot-on. Vocals dead center.
good: Almost perfect. Just a slight tilt somewhere.
Good blend overall. Tiny mismatch pulling the image a touch.
Balance nearly there. A small placement tweak will sort it.
okay: Either bass is heavy or mids are pushing forward.
Stereo image leaning to one side due to distance mismatch.
Needs a toe-in tweak to get the tonal balance right.
needs_work: Room is skewing the tone. Things sound uneven.
One speaker is dominating. Distances need fixing.
Mid-bass and midrange aren’t blending properly.

excellent: Try 1–2° of toe-in to lock vocals even tighter.
Match both speaker distances exactly — millimetres matter.
Adjust one speaker's height 1–2 cm if the centre image drifts.
good: Toe-in by 2–3° to tighten the centre image.
Measure to each tweeter from your seat — exact match needed.
If the sound pulls left/right, move the seat 3–5 cm.
okay: Shift the seat 5–10 cm if the image leans to one side.
Reduce toe-in if mids feel too shouty.
Widen speakers 5–10 cm to rebalance things.
needs_work: Re-measure distances precisely — no eyeballing.
Pull speakers forward to reduce room-boosted bass.
Toe-in the weaker side slightly more to rebalance.

excellent: Beautifully smooth. Nothing poking out.
Even decay. Easy, non-fatiguing sound.
Driver transitions are seamless.
good: Mostly smooth with a couple of tiny ripples.
Clean flow with small bumps around the crossover.
Nearly silky — small tweak will finish it.
okay: Some noticeable wiggles across the curve.
Rough patches in the critical mids.
Unevenness caused by room or placement.
needs_work: Large bumps across multiple frequencies.
Sound feels brittle or rough — too many uneven spots.
Jagged curve. Placement causing major issues.

excellent: Toe-in 1–2° to smooth the mids even further.
Make sure speakers are level — tiny tilts cause roughness.
Mark the positions — it’s worth saving.
good: Pull speakers 3–5 cm forward to soften small wiggles.
Toe-in about 2° to remove upper-mid harshness.
Move seat slightly off the centre line.
okay: Move speakers forward 10–15 cm to flatten upper bass/lower mids.
Try 3–4° toe-in adjustments to soften edges.
Shift seat left/right 5–10 cm to dodge resonances.
needs_work: Pull speakers 20–30 cm from the wall to calm big bumps.
Reduce toe-in if mids/highs sound harsh.
Move seat forward 20–40 cm to escape modal chaos.

excellent: Decay is tight and controlled — ideal.
Room gets out of the way quickly.
Fast, clean, and not echoey.
good: Slightly lively but still clean.
Good decay. A little softening will tidy it.
Nice control — just needs a touch more damping.
okay: Decay is a bit long, blurring detail.
Tail lingers. Needs soft surfaces nearby.
A bit loose. Could benefit from floor/ceiling help.
needs_work: Decay tail very long. Room colouring everything.
Room ringing. Needs softening straight away.
Reflections stacking up — decay far too slow.

excellent: Close curtains or add a throw to trim the high-frequency tail.
Small rug in front of speakers helps polish things.
Tiny toe-in changes can tighten decay.
good: Add a rug or mat to slightly shorten decay.
Close curtains fully to soften highs.
Widen speakers slightly to even out reflections.
okay: Put a rug directly between speakers and seat.
Add cushions/throws to nearby bare walls.
Reduce toe-in if treble feels too strong.
needs_work: Add soft surfaces ASAP — rug, curtains, throws.
Move speakers away from glass or empty corners.
Move seat away from room centre — decay builds there.

overall_excellent: Spot-on result. System and room are working together beautifully.
You’ve hit the sweet spot — nothing major left to fix.
The room is basically transparent. Top-tier outcome.
Clean, controlled, and engaging. Enjoy it — you’ve nailed it.
overall_good: Really strong result. Only small tweaks left.
Great foundation. A couple of small adjustments will perfect it.
The main problems are already sorted. You're close to reference.
A tight setup. Touch up the yellows and you're done.
overall_fair: Solid start. Still some room influence in the mids and bass.
You're close. Fix one big issue and the rest will fall into place.
Some rough edges, totally normal. Tackle the worst metric first.
Room is adding personality — time to tidy up the trouble spots.
overall_poor: Don’t worry — this is where everyone begins. Easy fixes ahead.
Room interaction is dominating. A few basic moves will help a lot.
Acoustics aren’t cooperating yet, but it’s all fixable.
Messy but fixable. Follow the steps and re-sweep — it will improve fast.
